definitions.example: The power plant consumes 30 tons of coal per hour.
Baby birds consume their own weight in food each day.

definitions.definition: To completely occupy the thoughts or attention of.

definitions.example: The building was consumed by fire.

definitions.definition: To trade money for good or services as an individual.
definitions.example: If you consume this product while in Japan, you may be subject to consumption tax.

definitions.definition: To absorb information, especially through the mass media.
definitions.example: The Internet has changed the way we consume news.

definitions.definition: Consumption; the process by which something is consumed
